intro: Selatium attenuatum, commonly known as the slender selatium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Selatium attenuatum is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
